title: A really simple guide to the election
description: If you’re looking for a refresher or trying to understand it for the first time, this guide will help.

title: Hurricane Epsilon: Surfers tackle 20ft waves in Cornwall
description: Strong winds and low pressure created 'extremely dangerous' conditions off the coast of Cornwall.

title: US election 2020: The farmer helping Mexican immigrants
description: For one farmer in Wisconsin, undocumented workers are a lifeline. And he's going to great lengths to repay them.

title: Why soy sauce is causing a stir
description: The Department for International Trade slips up in a tweet about Bake Off.

title: Lily Allen: 'Women masturbating in a relationship isn't wrong'
description: The singer says women should stop feeling ashamed talking about self-love.

title: Black men 'stopped and searched by Met over fist bump'
description: A review of the Met's use of stop-and-search powers finds "much room for improvement".

title: Man Utd modify Old Trafford to hold 23,500 socially distanced fans
description: Manchester United have modified Old Trafford to accommodate 23,500 spectators, and say they are "bemused" by the ongoing ban on fans.

title: Covid in Scotland: 78 patients sent to care homes after testing positive
description: A report reveals 78 patients who had tested positive were sent to care homes in the early weeks of the pandemic.

title: Covid: Nottinghamshire to enter tier 3 from Friday
description: The entire county is set to move into the top tier of Covid restrictions at the same time on Friday.

title: Covid-19: 'Too early to say' what Christmas rules will be says minister
description: Environment Secretary George Eustice says people "may not be able to get together in larger groups".

title: Channel migrants: Deaths should be 'a wake-up call' for those in power
description: Charities call for a legal route for refugees to reach the UK, after four die crossing the Channel.

title: Henshaw replaces injured Ringrose for Ireland's Six Nations decider in France
description: Centre Robbie Henshaw replaces injured Garry Ringrose in the Ireland team for Saturday's Six Nations game against France in Paris.

title: Coronavirus: Germany and France to decide on new lockdowns
description: While Germany is planning a "lockdown light", France is deciding new measures too.

title: Comic Relief will stop sending celebrities to Africa
description: The charity will also stop using images of starving people or ill children in its fundraising show.

title: Migrant crossings: What happens to migrants who reach the UK?
description: The government wants to cut the number of migrants crossing the Channel.

title: Saudi Arabian GP on provisional schedule for 2021
description: Saudi Arabia is set to make its debut on the Formula 1 calendar next year, with a race on a street circuit in Jeddah.

title: Claire Parry death: PC Timothy Brehmer jailed for manslaughter
description: Timothy Brehmer and Claire Parry had a secret relationship for more than 10 years, his trial heard.

title: Great Barrier Reef: Scientists find reef taller than Empire State Building
description: Standing 500m (1,640ft) tall, the "blade-like" reef was found off Australia's far north.

title: Todd Gurley scores for Atlanta Falcons losing them game against Detroit Lions
description: Jason Bell and Osi Umenyiora discuss Todd Gurley's accidental touchdown that led to the Atlanta Falcons losing in dramatic fashion to the Detroit Lions.

title: Kim Kardashian West mocked for 'humble' birthday party on private island
description: The reality star is accused of being "tone deaf" for posting photos of her family's lavish trip.

title: Shaunagh Brown column: I didn't know we had won the Six Nations
description: In her first BBC Sport column, England prop Shaunagh Brown explains how she had to be reminded she had won the Six Nations.

title: Coronavirus: Inside Altnagelvin Hospital's battle with Covid-19
description: The BBC is given exclusive access to Altnagelvin Hospital in Londonderry, one of the busiest in the UK.

title: Roy Francis: The black head coach who revolutionised rugby league
description: Roy Francis was a rugby revolutionary and the first black coach in elite British sport, yet his story has largely been forgotten.

title: Newspaper headlines: Second wave warning and 'tragedy in the Channel'
description: Warnings the second wave of Covid could be more deadly and the death of four migrants lead the papers.

title: Police officer raiding illegal cockfight gets killed by rooster
description: Lt Christine Bolok was struck by a gaffed rooster on his left thigh, slicing his femoral artery.

title: Leaving care: ‘I made it to university, but then I fell through the cracks'
description: Young care leaver Kim Emenike made it to university against the odds - then social services forgot about her.

title: How KSI earned more than his teachers by playing Fifa
description: The YouTuber built a multi million-pound business empire from his bedroom. Now he's pursuing music.

title: Danny and Dani Dyer launch new podcast to solve your problems
description: The father and daughter spoke to the BBC's Colin Paterson about their new podcast.

title: US election: A generational divide over Trump among Vietnamese-Americans
description: Young Vietnamese-Americans see things differently to elders who settled in US after the Vietnam War.

title: Covid-19: 'I'll be hosting my Christmas over Zoom'
description: Some families are already making plans and getting ready for a "digital Christmas" this year.

title: Fabinho injury last thing we needed - Klopp
description: Fabinho's injury is "exactly the last thing we needed", says Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp after the Brazilian adds to the club's defensive problems.

title: Surviving a week in Afghanistan
description: One violent week in a long war. Here are some of those who died and those who survived.

title: Black History Month: ‘People are afraid to say the wrong thing’
description: Pioneering black women in the arts talk about diversity and their struggles to get to the top.

title: Skin cancer: How do I check my moles for signs of melanoma?
description: Influencer Molly-Mae Hague, 21, is raising awareness about skin cancer among young people.

title: Mum, Dad, money and me
description: Many people find talking about money awkward, particularly with their parents - so how do their views differ?

title: ‘Shops refusing cash left me unable to buy basics’
description: The cash system is being threatened by some shops not accepting cash, says Consumer group Which?
